page.title: 15RECREATION
page.content: { Eureka Park}was set out in the 1920's. It's named after an old colliery which was found here. It is an early example of reclaimed derelict land. It provides these activities: {tennis courts, bowling green, gardens {& open areas for games.}The local firemen use it for their bonfire and firework display on November 5th. Opposite the park are{Granville Fish {Ponds}stocked for coarse fishing with roach, rudd, bream, tench, carp, perch & pike. Conservationists are worried about the lead shot, used as weights by anglers which poses a threat to the wildfowl living on the ponds, mainly the swans. The local council's draft plan includes details to improve the area by improving the bank to make fishing safer & dredging the badly silted parts. Footpaths to the ponds are to be improved.
